data.title: Answered by TBS's Team of NetSuite Experts
data.meta_description: NetSuite FAQ's including module and functionality questions, history of Oracle NetSuite, customer questions, industry and general NetSuite advice.
data.text:
NetSuite is managed via a web-based application accessed through the internet. It requires users to have an Internet connection, an e-mail address, and then authentication into your account.

NetSuite offers multiple types of access options including:

Web-based: allows remote access to your data and functionality over an internet connection.

Mobile: allows you to view and update transactions, enter new transactions, and request approvals on the go with mobile devices such as smartphones and tablets.

Describe the item or answer the question so that site visitors who are interested get more information. You can emphasize this text with bullets, italics or bold, and add links.

NetSuite Purchase Orders give businesses the ability to track purchases made by customers, vendors, employees and company representatives all from one centralized system. This includes features such as:

Approving or rejecting PO's

Creating, updating and tracking PO's

Storing purchase order information in the cloud for easy access and sharing between team members and locations

Organizing POs by status or category

There are a few ways to backup NetSuite. The most common way is to export your data into a CSV file. You can also use the built-in backup feature, which allows you to create a backup of your company data on a periodic basis. This being said, as a True Cloud ERP, NetSuite ensures double back up of your company file in multiple datacentres around the world as a part of your subscription fee.

NetSuite is a great option for small businesses because it is a cloud-based ERP that is affordable and easy to use. It includes features such as invoicing, purchase orders, revenue recognition, and more, that can help small businesses manage their finances and operations more effectively. NetSuite also offers the ability to scale as your business grows, so it can continue to meet your needs.

NetSuite is relatively easy to learn, and most users are able to get up and running within a few weeks. However, like any software, the more you use it, the more you will learn and be able to take advantage of all that NetSuite has to offer.

NetSuite is a great option for businesses of all sizes. It is a cloud-based ERP that is affordable and easy to use, and includes features such as invoicing, purchase orders, revenue recognition, and more. NetSuite also offers the ability to scale as your business grows, so it can continue to meet your needs. It also comes in many different editions, largely preconfigured to suit the needs of many industries.

NetSuite is used by businesses of all sizes and industries. It is a cloud-based ERP that is affordable and easy to use, and includes features such as invoicing, purchase orders, revenue recognition, and more. NetSuite also offers the ability to scale as your business grows, so it can continue to meet your needs.

NetSuite offers businesses benefits that other software solutions, such as an on-premise enterprise resource planning (ERP) system, do not.

One example is its flexibility. While many on-premise ERPs can only be set up to work with certain types of financials and industry standards, NetSuite offers versatility because it uses cloud technology rather than traditional software systems. This means that users can configure their system to work around existing limitations or even update their system without making changes to their core business processes.

NetSuite and QuickBooks are both popular options for businesses when it comes to accounting and financial software. Both programs offer a number of features that can help businesses manage their finances and operations more effectively. However, there are some key differences between the two programs.

QuickBooks is a desktop program that is installed on a computer. This means that businesses must purchase and maintain the software, as well as upgrade to new versions when they become available. NetSuite, on the other hand, is a cloud-based ERP that is affordable and easy to use. It includes features such as invoicing, purchase orders, revenue recognition, and more, that can help small businesses manage their finances and operations more effectively.

NetSuite also offers the ability to scale as your business grows, so it can continue to meet your needs.

NetSuite (formerly NetLedger) was founded in 1998 and has served over 30,000 customers across 165 countries. It provides cloud-based financials/ERP software for businesses of all sizes that includes invoicing, purchase orders, revenue recognition, multi-currency transactions and more. It also offers the ability to scale as your business grows so it can continue to meet your needs.

The company operates on a Software as a Service model with subscriptions that are affordable and easy to use. This means services can be accessed anywhere you have an internet connection whether at home or on the go.

Technically, it is both. The CRM modules is one of a number of modules that makes NetSuite a leading ERP. NetSuite is an Business Management Platform that offers businesses a number of features to help them manage their finances and operations more effectively. It also offers the ability to scale as your business grows, so it can continue to meet your needs

Yes, NetSuite is a Software as a Service (SaaS) application. This means that users can access the software and its features via the internet, without having to install it on their computer. This makes it easy for businesses to use, regardless of their location or size. Additionally, NetSuite offers a number of features that can help businesses manage their finances and operations more effectively.

NetSuite OneWorld is a global business management platform that offers businesses a number of features to help them manage their finances and operations more effectively. It also offers the ability to scale as your business grows, so it can continue to meet your needs. The platform is available in over 165 countries and supports multiple currencies. Additionally, it offers a number of features that can help businesses manage their finances and operations more effectively.

SAP offers ERP solutions that are complex to implement and support. They also require significant upfront investment in both time and training. NetSuite provides an alternative with a powerful suite of business applications that can be implemented quickly and easily, saving you time and money while accelerating growth.

Dynamics AX requires extensive professional services to configure the solution for your business which drives up implementation costs significantly. Additionally, Microsoft's licensing model makes it difficult to scale as your business grows so you are forced to purchase more licenses as you expand your business. NetSuite offers a flexible, affordable and easy-to-use solution for growing businesses that can easily scale as your business grows so it can continue to meet your needs.

NetSuite provides an alternative to traditional ERP systems that are complex to implement and support. It also requires significant upfront investment in both time and training, which often makes it impractical for rapidly growing companies. Instead, businesses can use NetSuite's business management platform with modules spanning from Accounting/ERP & eCommerce, Customer Relationship Management (CRM), Projects, Inventory/POS/eCommerce Order Management and more.

NetSuite is available anywhere you have an internet connection via a simple, browser-based interface that can be used on any device.

Ideal for growing businesses as NetSuite offers a flexible suite of business applications that are easy to implement and support, saving you time and money while accelerating growth

Flexible pricing models make it affordable to subscribe based on your unique needs instead of requiring you to purchase additional licenses as your business grows

Built-in features allow you to easily manage multiple currencies so international expansion is painless

Robust API allows users create custom modules or integrate with other systems for streamlined operations

Stunning mobile functionality lets users work on the go whether they're in the warehouse or traveling across the globe

NetSuite offers a simple, browser-based interface that can be used on any device. You can work on invoices in the office or at home, then continue editing them from your smartphone while you're waiting for lunch to arrive.

Additionally, it offers advanced functionality like dashboards and custom reports that help users monitor key metrics for their business so they can make informed decisions about product lines and marketing campaigns. This helps drive increased productivity, growth and profits.

SuiteSuccess is the name of NetSuite's implementation and support service. It provides customers with access to a team of experienced implementation consultants as well as 24/7 support for system issues. This means you can get up and running quickly and easily without any stress or headaches.
